list_definition.definition: (also shooting star) a small mass or body travelling very quickly through space which appears very bright after entering the earth’s atmosphere

list_ex_of_english: A single observer would find it impossible to distinguish the meteor as being far from the realm of the stars.
Maybe the report of a meteor airburst event just before the falls of red rain is not purely coincidental.
Other teams using the standard model were either unsuccessful, or had to use fitting to past meteor storms to empirically set their prediction parameters.
These will be the last meteor storms visible in our lifetime.
Then instead of a star over some variable glyph, the actual logograph was meant to depict a star in motion-a meteor.
Shouldn't the term be applied to students of meteors and other heavenly bodies?
Most reports of red rain are reported as isolated instances and have no association with comets or meteors.
Since they do occur fairly regularly, one could conceivably attempt a correlation of the major yearly meteor showers with the timing of warfare.
